programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: North Carolina (12-7, 5-2) had its four-win streak ended by Stanford, 72-71, but won 14 of the last 18 meetings after an 85-64 win last season; Wake Forest (14-4, 6-1) is 9-0 at home behind Hunter Sallis, who is second in the ACC with 19.5 ppg.

programme.title: 2025 Australian Open
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner, Alexander Zverev, Carlos Alcaraz and Taylor Fritz are the top four seeds in the men's draw; Aryna Sabalenka, Iga Swiatek, Coco Gauff and Jasmine Paolini are the top-seeded women in the 128-player draw for the year's first major event.

programme.title: TGL Golf
programme.desc: The inaugural golf league combines advanced technology with teams, which are made up of PGA TOUR players representing six different cities, facing off in a head-to-head competition; New York Golf Club (0-1) takes on Atlanta Drive GC (0-0) in Week 3.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Sacramento claimed victories over Golden State in three of their five meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup in Apr.'s play-in tournament, 118-94; Keegan Murray posted 32 points and 9 rebounds for the Kings in the win.

programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wichita State (11-7, 1-4) beat the Tigers, 71-65, in the 2024 AAC Tournament after losing the previous eight meetings; No. 24 Memphis (14-4, 4-1) won five of its last six behind PJ Haggerty, who is second in the country in scoring with 22.1 ppg.

programme.title: High School Basketball
programme.desc: Montverde Academy, which features five players in the ESPN 100, is led by Hudson Greer; Duke signees Cameron and Cayden Boozer, both top-20 recruits in the ESPN 100 and the sons of former NBA player Carlos Boozer, highlight the Columbus roster.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Appalachian State (11-7, 5-2) won four-straight games behind Myles Tate; Arkansas State (14-5, 5-2) is 9-0 at home behind Taryn Todd, who leads the Red Wolves with 16.3 ppg, and beat the Mountaineers, 67-65, in the 2024 Sun Belt Tournament.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (12-6, 5-2) won three-straight games behind Ryan Kalklbrenner, and won its last 20 meetings with the Blue Demons, including an 84-58 road win last season; DePaul (10-9, 1-7) ended a five-game skid with a 73-68 win over Georgetown.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (12-6, 5-2) won three-straight games behind Ryan Kalklbrenner, and won its last 20 meetings with the Blue Demons, including an 84-58 road win last season; DePaul (10-9, 1-7) ended a five-game skid with a 73-68 win over Georgetown.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (8-10, 1-6) ended a nine-game skid with an 82-77 win over Seton Hall behind Pierre Brooks II; No. 19 UConn (13-5, 5-2) is 8-1 at home behind Alex Karaban, who leads the Huskies with 15.6 ppg, and won all 10 meetings with the Bulldogs.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Nevada (11-7, 3-4) won its last three games; Utah State (16-2, 6-1) had its six-game win streak snapped by UNLV, 65-62, but won seven of its last 10 meetings with the Wolf Pack after a 69-64 win on Dec. 31 behind 17 points from Ian Martinez.

programme.title: College Basketball

programme.title: Empty Cup: Quest for the 1992 NASCAR Championship
programme.desc: Davey Allison had a tumultuous journey to compete for the 1992 Winston Cup Championship, nearly derailing his chances at the Winston All-Star race before holding a points lead going into the final race of the circuit, the Hooters 500.

programme.title: I Am Kevin Harvick
programme.desc: The decorated career of NASCAR racing legend Kevin Harvick is documented, showcasing his two Busch Series titles, his run to the 2014 Cup Series championship and amassing 60 Cup Series wins over his 23-year career racing in the top division.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: The FOX Big Noon Kickoff crew goes on the road different campuses across the country and discusses the biggest games of the weekend, while evaluating player performances; experts weigh in on trending topics and teams throughout the nation.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (12-7, 4-4) won three-straight games; No. 20 St. John's (16-3, 7-1) won its last five, including an 82-72 win over the Musketeers on Jan. 7 behind 18 points from Zuby Ejiofor and RJ Luis Jr., who is third in the Big East with 17.8 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (12-7, 4-4) won three-straight games; No. 20 St. John's (16-3, 7-1) won its last five, including an 82-72 win over the Musketeers on Jan. 7 behind 18 points from Zuby Ejiofor and RJ Luis Jr., who is third in the Big East with 17.8 ppg.

programme.title: NFL Films Presents

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: UCLA is coming off of claiming a 72-57 victory over Baylor in the Coretta Scott King Classic on Jan. 20, led by a 24-point, 9-block performance from Lauren Betts; Yaya Felder posted 10 points and an assist for the Bears in the defeat.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Truant, a Border Collie, won last year.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Maryland (14-5, 4-4) won three of its last four games, and won 10 of the last 13 meetings, including a 76-67 road win last season; No. 17 Illinois (13-5, 5-3) is 8-2 at home behind Kasparas Jakucionis, who leads the team with 15.9 ppg.

programme.title: FS1 College Hoops Extra
programme.desc: Hosts and analysts provide the latest highlights and scores to games in college basketball from around the country, providing analysis on the games that have concluded and going on, along with a preview of the upcoming matchups.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (12-6, 5-2) won three-straight games behind Ryan Kalklbrenner, and won its last 20 meetings with the Blue Demons, including an 84-58 road win last season; DePaul (10-9, 1-7) ended a five-game skid with a 73-68 win over Georgetown.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (8-10, 1-6) ended a nine-game skid with an 82-77 win over Seton Hall behind Pierre Brooks II; No. 19 UConn (13-5, 5-2) is 8-1 at home behind Alex Karaban, who leads the Huskies with 15.6 ppg, and won all 10 meetings with the Bulldogs.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: World Series of Bowling brings you the PBA World Championship; Competitors in the tournament include the top 50 2021 PBA Tour point leaders, PBA Tour title holders, 20 international invitees with 15 invited directly by PBA.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Fort Lauderdale International Boat Show
programme.desc: A look at the greatest and biggest boat show in the world, a five-day attraction that has various exhibitors from all over the world showcasing their products and services, such as superyachts, sunscreen, sunglasses, seminars, restaurants, and more.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed victories over Al-Khaleej in five of their last six meetings while drawing once and winning the most recent matchup in the King's Cup semifinals, 3-1; Cristiano Ronaldo found the net with a brace assisted by Ayman Ahmed in the win.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Shabab has claimed victories over Al-Ittihad in two straight league meetings, winning the most recent matchup on Apr. 26 with a 3-1 scoreline; Habib Diallo, Carlos Junior and Musab Al Juwayr found the net for Al-Shabab in the win.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: Tyquone Greer and Marquise Pryor lead Orr Academy basketball into the upcoming season under head coach Lou Adams, as the team deals with the inequities and troubling surrounding of Chicago as they strive for a championship and collegiate dreams.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The documentary chronicles the lives of incarcerated basketball players at San Quentin State Prison and explores inmates' personal struggles as they search for redemption and transcendence both on and off the court.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Bill O'Neill, who leads the tour in points through three events, Matt Russo, EJ Tackett, Jakob Butturff and Kim Bolleby are among the top players in the tournament; Pete Weber is the only player to win the Triple Crown twice over.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: EJ Tackett entered the tournament having finished no lower than fourth place in five PBA Tour title events in his home state since 2021; Tackett, along with Zach Wilkins, Kyle Troup, Pontus Andersson and Benjy Martinez were Top 5 through 24 games.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The Delaware Classic finals kick off; With $180,000 in winnings, the Delaware Classic tournament brings you nonstop excitment with some of the top stars of PBA, additional activities include a Pro-Am event to an elimination match play rounds.
